intro: Dichaetanthera oblongifolia var. albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflowered dichaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white flowers arranged in spikelets. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal.
